Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: to be dissolved and with our Savr  came happily to pass

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: Sacrament in the Church of England

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: strongly took hold of my Heart

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: I had never heard of any ones being awakend nor did I know there was such a Thing; so I concluded there was not another such vile wretch existing as my self.

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: I often fell prostrate on the Floor & with Floods of Tears, lamented my wretched state; some-Times I had a Glimmering of hope; these words often aleviated my distress perfect Love casts out Fear
column5: to which my heart answerd "Yes Lord
column6: that Fear hath Torment I know very well
column7: if there be a Love which casts it out

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: I was quite stund & thus I went directly out of the Church home, & then to my chamber, where I fell prostrate, & silently pourd forth Streams of Tears. I went on in a disconsolate Solitary way conversing but little with any one

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: Heart was in such a desolveing condition

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: our Savr presented himself to my Heart in his bleeding Wounded Form, & brought me into such a converse with his own dear person, as I had never known before, then it was that my heart went over to Him,

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: what we felt at that time I suppose will by no Body be forgot who was there till beyond the Grave

Subject: Elizabeth Claggett
Value: I was sent by the Congn  into Yorkshire
